IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GivenGain's mission is to enhance global philanthropy by operating a platform that provides technological, fundraising and administration support to US charities. In particular, GivenGain provides charities with access to an excellent, technologically advanced payment platform through which donations can be made to them securely, efficiently and cost-effectively, in any currency, by donors based worldwide. One World, Zero Barriers.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GivenGain's mission is to enhance global philanthropy by operating a platform that provides technological, fundraising and administration support to US charities. In particular, GivenGain provides charities with access to an excellent, technologically advanced payment platform through which donations can be made to them securely, efficiently and cost-effectively, in any currency, by donors based worldwide. One World, Zero Barriers.
IRS990.Desc: GivenGain through its service program, offers access to the GivenGain technology platform to US based registered charitable organizations to enhance their fundraising by connecting them, securely, efficiently and cost-effectively, with the word-wide base of fundraisers and donors registered on the platform. During 2021, GivenGain has made grants to the value of $1,383,805 to 103 US based charitable organizations from contribution received during the period.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: We make grants to charitable 501(c)3 organizations based on the recommendations we receive from donors on our platform. We do however monitor activity of organizations on a platform as follows: A screening of publicly available information is done. This helps to determine whether the organization is or has been implicated in any questionable activity. The screening includes a verification of: 3.1. Website with adequate information on projects and community; 3.2. Legitimate domain name in the name of the charity; 3.3. Primary user is an employee and uses an email address linked to the same charity domain name; 4. Verification that the organization does not appear on of the following list indicating links to terrorism or money laundering: 4.1. https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/office-of-foreign-assets-control- sanctions-programs-and-information
A review of the Form 990 was performed by the company secretary and Treasurer. The company secretary then shared findings and approval with the governing body.

a. The Members of the Board reviews all disclosed conflicts of interest, arising from completed conflict of interest questionnaires. b. In cases where a conflict of interest is identified, the individual involved is asked to provide additional information to assist in the review. c. The Board then determines the appropriate course of action, which may include recusal from decision-making, divestment of conflicting interests, or other measures to migate the conflict. 7. Mitigating Measures implemented: a. Recusal: When a conflict of interest exists, the involved party should recuse themselves from decisions, discussions, or actions related to the conflicted mater. b. Independent Oversight: Individuals responsible for addressing conflicts are independent and not directly involved in the conflicted situation. The composition of the Members of the Board include independent parties.
All documents are available through request via our support desk.
There are no committees in place to act on behalf of the governing body.

Net losses arose due to the following: general, administrative and fundraising expenses was incurred since incorporation, but operations only commenced during November of 2021, hence the higher expense rate for 2021.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation was incorporated during 2021, and only started trading in November 2021. The service organization that performed administrate tasks for the Foundation went through a corporate restructure during 2022, and it took longer than expected to implement new process and procedures, and hire appropriate staff to assist with financial and administrative tasks. This is also the first filing of the foundation.
